thread.title: Danny Welbeck Opens Up About Arsenal Teammate He Used To Hate
thread.title_full: Danny Welbeck Opens Up About Arsenal Teammate He Used To Hate

title: Danny Welbeck Opens Up About Arsenal Teammate He Used To Hate
text:
Danny Welbeck Opens Up About Arsenal Teammate He Used To Hate Wed Feb 22 2017 21:00:00   21:00:00 GMT+0000 (GMT) Ryan Sidle Ryan Sidle in football 
My auntie tells me that when she first met my uncle she did not like him. Danny Welbeck can appreciate that sentiment as he revealed which of his colleagues he used to hate. 
Famously not all teammates, or for that matter colleagues, get on and some, like Andy Cole and Teddy Sheringham downright loathe each other. 
However that ill feeling never stopped Teddy and Andy getting on once they were on the pitch and the pair made a decent strikeforce at Old Trafford during the Treble and three title wins for the Red Devils. 
For Danny Welbeck arriving at the Emirates in August 2014, as Radamel Falcao arrived at Old Trafford, he was united with one player he used to hate, Kieran Gibbs. 
As reported by Metro the Arsenal forward revealed his hatred of the full-back stretched back to their FA Youth Cup days saying: 
"It was the first time we prepared like it was a first team match. 
"It was a special moment. Obviously me and Gibbo are very close friends now but back then I used to hate him to be honest. 
"He was bigger than me, faster than me, he was so strong and I was like 'what is this guy about?" 
The pair met as Arsenal played Manchester United at the semi-final stage of the cup back in 2007, with the Manchester club coming out on top 4-3 on aggregate. 
Gibbs actually scored the opening goal in the tie, with Arsenal going 1-0 up at the Emirates, however Welbeck would have the last laugh, scoring the winner at Old Trafford. 
Fortunately now at the Emirates together the pair don't hate each other. 
I'm just not sure they'll end up with two kids together like my auntie and uncle but who knows... Sponsored Links
